meanings.definition: The state of being behind in payments or obligations.
meanings.sent1: She fell into arrearage on her rent after losing her job.
meanings.sent2: The company had to pay off the arrearage to avoid penalties.
meanings.sent3: The arrearage in her library fees made her the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: His arrearage in completing tasks was like a heavy weight on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The arrearage in his savings account grew larger each month.

meanings.sent1: The arrearage on the bill was causing stress for the family.
meanings.sent2: He finally settled the arrearage on his credit card.
meanings.sent3: The arrearage in returning the borrowed book was embarrassing.
meanings.sent4: The arrearage in repairing the old car seemed insurmountable.
meanings.sent5: The arrearage in her allowance made her budgeting skills improve.
